summary: AB de Villiers is a former South African international cricketer.

value.label: Abraham Benjamin de Villiers
Invalid Date (Age 35)
Warmbad, Transvaal, South Africa
ABD
South African
Batsman, Wicketkeeper

value.label: De Villiers is a right-handed batsman and an occasional wicket-keeper

image.altText: Style of play for AB de Villiers
image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: De Villiers made his first class debut for the South African domestic team Northerns
AB de Villiers made his international debut in a Test match against England
The England cricket team represents England and Wales in international cricket. England and Australia were the first teams to play a Test match in 1877
De Villiers' batting during the World Cup was inconsistent as he also failed to score on 4 occasions
De Villiers played for the Delhi Daredevils in the first 3 seasons of IPL
The Delhi Capitals are a franchise cricket team that represents the city of Delhi in the Indian Premier League (IPL).
De Villiers became the second-youngest and second-fastest South African to reach 1,000 test runs

image.altText: De Villiers became the second-youngest and second-fastest South African to reach 1,000 test runs

value.label: In 2008 de Villiers became the first South African to score a double century

image.altText: In 2008 de Villiers became the first South African to score a double century

value.label: In 2011 de Villiers became the first South African to score two centuries in a single World Cup

image.altText: In 2011 de Villiers became the first South African to score two centuries in a single World Cup

value.label: In 2015, playing against West Indies, de Villiers scored the fastest century by a batsman in One Day International cricket, off 31 balls

image.altText: In 2015, playing against West Indies, de Villiers scored the fastest century by a batsman in One Day International cricket, off 31 balls

value.label: In 2015, de Villiers held the record holder for the fastest 50, 100 and 150 in One-Day International history

image.altText: In 2015, de Villiers held the record holder for the fastest 50, 100 and 150 in One-Day International history

value.label: The South African national cricket team, nicknamed the Proteas is administered by Cricket South Africa. South Africa is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test, One Day International (ODI) and Twenty20 International (T20I) status.

image.altText: Picture of South Africa national cricket team

value.label: The Royal Challengers Bangalore are a franchise cricket team based in Bangalore, Karnataka, that plays in the Indian Premier League (IPL)
Northerns is a first-class cricket team in South Africa and represents area nother of Johannesburg, and includes Pretoria
